remarks: Given the equivalences set in the hypotheses, there exist a proof where ch, th, ta, et match ze, si accordingly (Contributed by Jarvin Udandy, 7-Sep-2016.)
statement:
mdandyvr7.1 $e |- ( ph <-> ze ) $.
mdandyvr7.2 $e |- ( ps <-> si ) $.
mdandyvr7.3 $e |- ( ch <-> ps ) $.
mdandyvr7.4 $e |- ( th <-> ps ) $.
mdandyvr7.5 $e |- ( ta <-> ps ) $.
mdandyvr7.6 $e |- ( et <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr7 $p |- ( ( ( ( ch <-> si ) /\ ( th <-> si ) ) /\ ( ta <-> si ) ) /\ ( et <-> ze ) ) $.
